summary: RuleFactoryInterface incorrectly declares a generic type parameter that it doesn't actually define, causing PHPStan errors when implementing classes try to specify their own generic types. The interface extends TypeInterface<mixed> but RuleFactoryInterface itself is not generic, creating a template type conflict.
userImpact: Developers implementing custom types with RuleFactoryInterface get PHPStan errors preventing proper type specification.
rootCause: RuleFactoryInterface is declared with @extends TypeInterface<mixed> but the interface itself is not generic, preventing subclasses from properly specializing the template type parameter.
proposedFix: Make RuleFactoryInterface a generic interface with its own template parameter, or remove the @extends annotation if the interface doesn't need generic support.
keyQuote: RuleFactoryInterface is not a generic interface and does not give you the ability to specify your own type
